title: Simulation Education for Instructional Design of Sámi Language E-Book Development (Self-Directed)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic language education theory; no experience in digital content production
context.additional_context: Students simulate the Sámi Allus language e-book development process using VR tools in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, receiving step-by-step feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Understand and apply basic vocabulary and grammatical structures of Sámi languages with 80% accuracy.

Learners apply the 4D model (Define → Design → Develop → Disseminate) in a simulated environment to complete 1 prototype of a 10-page educational e-book within 2 weeks. They submit results meeting ≥4 out of 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria (≥80%)

Learners apply 3 content organization strategies (text, images, hyperlinks) and integrate ≥2 multimedia elements (audio/video) into smartphone-compatible e-book prototypes. They achieve ≥80% compliance with peer evaluation and instructor feedback criteria

resources: Sasaq Allus Language Learning Resource Kit
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
